alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 26 at 3:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Jersey, including the following county, Bergen. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding along small streams and in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain capable of causing minor small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.0 inches of rain have fallen in the area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hohokus Brook and Pascack Brook. The Saddle River north of Rochelle Park and the Hackensack River should remain below flood stage. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waldwick, Hohokus, and Westwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
